channel.title: CPU Upgrade? Need Suggestions -.-
channel.description:
Since college is coming up fast, I have started upgrading my laptop. It now has 2GB of ram (started with 256MB), and now it is time for a new CPU. I am not sure what I can upgrade it to, or how to find out what will work. From what I have read though, for my laptop, it is upgradable to 2.16GH'z.
Current Laptop: Dell Inspiron 6000 [img]http://thetechdiva.files.wordpress.com/2009/12/inspiron-6000.jpg[/img]
Current Processor: [img]http://i49.tinypic.com/o5thdd.png[/img]
Any help/suggestion is welcomed.

item.title: CPU Upgrade? Need Suggestions -.-
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you don’t have enough for a new laptop, then save your $20 up for a new computer, spending it on a new processor won’t give you any noticeable performance improvement, but may noticeably decrease your battery life or noticeably increase your heat.

Read full topic

Oh…here you go…a western digital 160gb harddrive for $42.99

newegg.com

Buy Western Digital Scorpio Blue 160Gb 5400Rpm Sata 7Pin 8Mb Buffer 2.5Inch Low Profile (1.0 Inch) Notebook Drive with fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!

More than half the price of the shit you posted and 2220000X10^12312123 times better. Okay maybe over exageration.
[/quote]

im going to assume his piece of shit hard drive is IDE and not sata.[/quote]
Rofl sorry not used to ide anymore

newegg.com

SAMSUNG Spinpoint M5 HM160HC 160GB 5400 RPM 8MB Cache ATA 2.5" Internal...

item.title: CPU Upgrade? Need Suggestions -.-
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

That is overpriced for what it is, a regular hard drive in a caddy. Just buy a 2.5" IDE HDD and stick it in the caddy in the laptop.

Read full topic

item.title: CPU Upgrade? Need Suggestions -.-
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Thug-life:

You won’t see much or any noticeable difference with that CPU upgrade. Spend the money on a quicker hard drive, you’d notice it then.

http://www.amazon.com/160GB-5400RPM-Dell-Inspiron-9200/dp/B000KICHWQ

A bit far above my usable budget.

Read full topic

item.title: CPU Upgrade? Need Suggestions -.-
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

your not going to upgrade your cpu for 20 dollars rofl. These kind of things cost 100+

Have found several 1.7GH’z for around 10, then another 9-10 for shipping sometimes. As long as I watch what I’m doing, I can. The ones you are talking about are the newer CPU’s, this laptop uses older ones, so they will tend to be cheaper.

Read full topic

item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

leave ur pc how it is, the socket your running is old and you won’t get a good cpu upgrade.

Read full topic

item.title: CPU Upgrade? Need Suggestions -.-
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Moparisthebest:

There is no reason to upgrade your CPU, if you want a better computer, buy one. A better CPU won’t help you out at all.

I have no job, so I am working with what I have. I had a $50 dollar budget to upgrade this laptop.I have $20 left after getting the RAM upgraded. Now I’m getting the CPU to what i can.

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:4, topic:347642”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=444023.msg3260366#msg3260366 date=1278448620]

http://www.cpu-world.com/Sockets/Socket%20479%20(mPGA479M).html

Good luck buying a CPU for a socket that came out in 2001.
As a general rule upgrading laptop CPUs is difficult and risky.

I found a 10-slot slide about doing it using my specific computer, otherwise i would not even be looking into doing this. Thanks for the site though, should help me out.

EDIT: I found this one on Ebay, does it look worth the buy? Or should I look for something larger?
http://cgi.ebay.com/Intel-Pentium-M-Centrino-1-7-GHz-400-Laptop-CPU-SL6N5-/130404213200?cmd=ViewItem&pt=CPUs&hash=item1e5cb261d0
[/quote]

Honestly I would spend the money to get something better, 1.7Ghz is kind of outdated by todays standards >.< But it is a laptop, I really only have experience with desktops.[/quote]
Yes, it is, but its better than 1.3GHz.

Read full topic
